context: The word 'olen' is the first person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'olema', which means 'to be'. It corresponds to English 'I am'. The verb 'olema' is an irregular verb and has different forms in different tenses. In present tense: olen (I am), on (he/she/it is), oleme (we are), olete (you are), on (they are).
